contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox road |state=IL |type=IL |maint=[[Illinois Department of Transportation|IDOT]] |route = 131 |length_mi = 15.15 |length_round = 2 |length_ref = <ref name=t2>{{cite web |author=Illinois Technology Transfer Center |url=http://www.dot.state.il.us/gist2/select.html |title=T2 GIS Data |accessdate=2007-11-08 |date=2006}}</ref> |direction_a=South |terminus_a = {{Jct|state=IL|IL|176}} in [[Lake Bluff, Illinois|Lake Bluff]] |direction_b=North |terminus_b ={{Jct|state=WI|WI|31}} in [[Winthrop Harbor, Illinois|Winthrop Harbor]] |counties = [[Lake County, Illinois|Lake]] |established = 1938<ref name=n9jig>Carlson, Rich. [http://www.n9jig.com/121-140.html Illinois Highways Page: Routes 121 thru 140]. Last updated April 15, 2005. Retrieved May 2, 2006.</ref> |previous_route = 130 |previous_type=IL |next_type=IL |next_route = 132 }} '''Illinois Route 131''' is a north–south state road in northeastern [[Illinois]]. It extends south from [[Highway 31 (Wisconsin)|Wisconsin Highway 31]] and Lake CR A1/19 (128th Street) at the Illinois/[[Wisconsin]] state line by [[Pleasant Prairie, WI|Pleasant Prairie]], south to [[Illinois Route 176]] in [[Lake Bluff, Illinois|Lake Bluff]], a distance of {{convert|15.15|mi|km|2}}.<ref name="t2" /> == Route description == Illinois 131 is called Green Bay Road for its entire length, but Green Bay Road becomes a residential street and extends south through various [[North Shore (Chicago)|North Shore]] communities to [[Evanston, Illinois|Evanston]], a distance of approximately {{convert|20|mi|km}} south of Illinois 176. It is one of very few state routes whose named road is longer than the marked state road. Green Bay Road actually continues south to Old Elm Road (Lake CR 52) while there is a second segment of Green Bay Road that starts at a dead end in Highwood and ends at Ridge Avenue in Evanston. The road parallels [[U.S. Route 41]] (Skokie Highway), which is only a few miles to the west, and [[Illinois Route 137]] ([[Amstutz Expressway]]), which is only a few miles to the east. It is the major north–south road between those two expressways. == History == SBI Route 131 ran from [[Mattoon, Illinois|Mattoon]] to [[Greenup, Illinois|Greenup]] in southeastern [[Illinois]]. This was dropped in 1937 for [[Illinois Route 121]]. The next year, Illinois 131 was used on a road that extended Highway 31 south into Illinois. This had formerly been [[Illinois Route 68]]. Had Illinois 31 not already been in use, the road south of Wisconsin may have been designated Illinois 31 instead.<ref name=n9jig/> == References == {{reflist}} {{Attached KML|display=inline,title}} [[Category:State highways in Illinois|1|31]]
